name: Puzzle Defence (Storm Howard)
description:
Defend yourself with the help of towers and the restriction of puzzle pieces

A tower defence game in which you place your towers by placing puzzle pieces into a puzzle.

Features
  • 23 custom waves
  • An endless mode
  • 4 unique towers
  • 7 unique enemies
  • Randomly generated puzzle pieces and map layouts

A Game made for the Mini Jam 71, with the theme Puzzles and limitation of combining two genres.

How to play

You buy puzzle pieces from the shop and place them in the puzzle somewhere to defend yourself from waves of enemies. These pieces can be moved once placed and swapped out for other pieces.

Can't place pieces? Make sure you follow these rules (I was planning on having a tutorial or something but ran out of time)

  • Edge pieces can only be placed on the edge, corner pieces can only be placed in the corners, and non-edge pieces can't be placed on the edges or corners.
  • Pieces can only be placed next to other pieces (including paths).
  • Pieces can only fit in like normal puzzle pieces can.

Note: There is no sound in the game due to time limitations, and when going fullscreen the mouse doesn't work properly.
